document.title:
INFANT'S ADVIL CONCENTRATED DROPS
INFANT'S ADVIL CONCENTRATED DROPS (Dye-Free)
(Ibuprofen)

list.item: reduces fever
relieves minor aches and pains due to the common cold, flu, headaches and toothaches

text.paragraph: Ibuprofen may cause a severe allergic reaction, especially in people allergic to aspirin. Symptoms may include:

list.item: hives
facial swelling
asthma (wheezing)
shock
skin reddening
rash
blisters

text.paragraph: If an allergic reaction occurs, stop use and seek medical help right away.
This product contains an NSAID, which may cause severe stomach bleeding. The chance is higher if the child

list.item: has had stomach ulcers or bleeding problems
takes a blood thinning (anticoagulant) or steroid drug
takes other drugs containing prescription or nonprescription NSAIDs [aspirin, ibuprofen, naproxen, or others]
takes more or for a longer time than directed

text.paragraph: NSAIDs, except aspirin, increase the risk of heart attack, heart failure, and stroke. These can be fatal. The risk is higher if you use more than directed or for longer than directed.

list.item: if the child has ever had an allergic reaction to any other pain reliever/fever reducer
right before or after heart surgery

section.title: Ask a doctor before use if

list.item: stomach bleeding warning applies to the child
child has problems or serious side effects from taking pain relievers or fever reducers
child has a history of stomach problems, such as heartburn
child has high blood pressure, heart disease, liver cirrhosis, kidney disease, asthma, or had a stroke
child has not been drinking fluids
child has lost a lot of fluid due to vomiting or diarrhea
child is taking a diuretic

section.title: Ask a doctor or pharmacist before use if the child is

list.item: under a doctor's care for any serious condition
taking any other drug
take with food or milk if stomach upset occurs

section.title: Stop use and ask a doctor if

list.item:
child experiences any of the following signs of stomach bleeding:
feels faint
vomits blood
has bloody or black stools
has stomach pain that does not get better

child has symptoms of heart problems or stroke:
chest pain
trouble breathing
weakness in one part or side of the body
slurred speech
leg swelling
child does not get any relief within first day (24 hours) of treatment
fever or pain gets worse or lasts more than 3 days
redness or swelling is present in the painful area
any new symptoms appear

code.displayName: OTC - KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN SECTION

text.paragraph: Keep out of reach of children. In case of overdose, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.

item.content: this product does not contain directions or complete warnings for adult use
do not give more than directed

list.item: find right dose on chart below. If possible, use weight to dose; otherwise use age.
repeat dose every 6-8 hours, if needed
do not use more than 4 times a day
measure with the dosing device provided. Do not use with any other device.
one dose lasts 6-8 hours
see bottom of box for lot number and expiration date

text.paragraph: acetic acid, artificial flavor, butylated hydroxytoluene, carboxymethylcellulose sodium, citric acid monohydrate, edetate disodium, glycerin, microcrystalline cellulose, polysorbate 80, propylene glycol, purified water, sodium benzoate, sorbitol solution, sucrose, xanthan gum
Call toll-free 1-800-88-ADVIL or ask your pharmacist, doctor or health care professional
For most recent product information, visit www.Advil.com.
